excerpt: Archaeology museum displaying Greek artifacts excavated from the surrounding Valley of the Temples.
detail_description: The Archaeological Museum "Pietro Griffo" of Agrigento is situated near the West Entrance of the Valley of the Temples. It's named after Pietro Griffo, an Italian archeologist, and it houses a diverse collection of artifacts such as ceramics, sculptures, coins, and jewelry. These items offer a comprehensive insight into the historical and cultural legacy of the region.
name: Archaeological Museum "Pietro Griffo" of Agrigento
address: Contrada San Nicola, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Agrigento is a hilltop city on Sicily's southwest shore. It's known for the ruins of the ancient city of Akragas in the Valley of the Temples, a vast archaeological site with well-preserved Greek temples. On the modern city's outskirts is the Museo Archeologico Regionale 'Pietro Griffo', with artifacts and a telamon (giant male figure). West lies Scala dei Turchi, a stepped white cliff overlooking sandy beaches.
detail_description: Agrigento, a hilltop city on Sicily's southwest shore, is renowned for the well-preserved Greek temples in the Valley of the Temples. The Museo Archeologico Regionale 'Pietro Griffo' showcases artifacts and a giant male figure. Nearby lies Scala dei Turchi, a white cliff overlooking sandy beaches.
name: Agrigento

excerpt: Vast archaeological site with ancient temples, ruins of Akragas city & a museum designed by Minissi.
detail_description: Valley of the Temples is a vast archaeological site in Sicily, featuring ancient temples and ruins of the city of Akragas. The city, known as Agrigentum to the Romans, was situated on a high plateau with a panoramic view. It boasted exceptional prosperity and magnificence, attracting foreign visitors.
name: Valley of the Temples

detail_description: The Monache cistercensi di Santo Spirito, also known as the Abbey Church and Convent of the Holy Spirit, is a remarkable example of medieval art and Chiaramonte style in Sicily. It stands as one of the most captivating monuments in Agrigento's historical center. The monastery is home to cloistered nuns who continue to preserve ancient recipes from the convent's bakery, including almond macaroons, couscous, and other sweet treats.
name: Monache Cistercensi di Santo Spirito
address: Cortile Santo Spirito, 9 8, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: In downtown Agrigento, you'll find the Theatro Luigi Pirandello, a historic theater located at the entrance to the town hall. This architectural gem was built in 1870 and has been a prominent cultural venue in the city. It's not just a beautiful building; it also hosts theatrical events that visitors can enjoy. The theater is named after Luigi Pirandello, a renowned writer and Nobel laureate known for his novels and plays.
name: Theatre Luigi Pirandello
address: P.za Luigi Pirandello, 35, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: In the heart of Agrigento, Italy, lies the Chiesa di Santa Maria dei Greci, a Norman church with a rich history. Constructed on the grounds of an ancient Greek temple dating back to the 5th century BC, this site has witnessed various rulers and cultural influences over time. The church features well-preserved Norman wooden ceilings and Byzantine frescoes that offer a glimpse into its storied past.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria dei Greci
address: Salita Santa Maria dei Greci, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Via Atenea is a bustling street in Agrigento, Italy, known for its vibrant atmosphere and historical landmarks. Surrounding attractions include Teatro Pirandello, the Viale, and the Greek amphitheater. Additionally, visitors can explore the famous Valley of the Temples nearby, offering stunning views of Agrigento and the Mediterranean Sea.
name: Via Atenea

detail_description: Chiesa di San Lorenzo detta del Purgatorio, also known as Purgatory Church, was finished in 1761 and funded by a prosperous neighborhood. The church boasts a magnificent reddish-golden tufa facade with a white doorway framed by twisted columns. Inside, visitors can admire deep-relief stuccoes created in the late 1600s by Giacomo Serpotta, a prominent figure of the Sicilian Baroque style.
name: Chiesa di San Lorenzo detta del Purgatorio
address: Via Atenea-piazzetta Purgatorio, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

excerpt: Archaeological site featuring the remains of a large Greek temple, including toppled stone atlases.
detail_description: The Temple of Olympian Zeus is an impressive archaeological site featuring the remains of a large Greek temple, including toppled stone atlases. The park also houses various historical structures such as the monumental pyramid-shaped Tomb of Terone, three shrines, a Hellenistic-Roman district, and the Giambertoni necropolis.
name: Temple of Olympian Zeus

excerpt: Centuries-old olive trees & orange blossoms, plus tours of Ancient Greek underground chambers.
detail_description: Nestled in the Valley of the Temples, Giardino della Kolymbethra is a centuries-old oasis featuring ancient olive trees, fragrant orange blossoms, and traditional citrus gardens. Managed by the heritage organization FAI, this charming garden offers a refreshing contrast to the surrounding temple landscape. Visitors can explore the living museum of almond trees and learn about ancient Greek underground chambers through guided tours. While there is an additional charge for entry, UK National Trust members enjoy free admission.
name: Giardino della Kolymbethra
address: Viale Caduti di Marzabotto, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Cathedral City Center is a vibrant and bustling area in the heart of Sicily, just a short 20-minute drive from the stunning Scala dei Turchi cliffs. This central location offers easy access to the city's main attractions, including historic cathedrals, charming cafes, and lively markets. Visitors can immerse themselves in the rich culture and architecture of this picturesque destination while being within reach of the breathtaking natural wonders that surround it.
name: Cathedral City Center
address: Via S. Vincenzo, 30, 92100 Agrigento AG, Italy

detail_description: Scalinata degli Artisti is a unique and colorful staircase located in Agrigento, Sicily. Each step features messages in different languages, while street art adorns the stairs and nearby walls. This spot is a product of the non-profit organization Culturart and has been recognized as one of the 16 most colorful staircases globally. Visitors can also find a smaller staircase decorated like piano keys nearby.
name: Scalinata degli Artisti

detail_description: The Temple of the Dioscuri is part of a larger archaeological site that includes several other ancient temples and sanctuaries. The temple is located in the western sector, alongside other majestic structures like the Temple of Herakles, Temple of Juno, and Temple of Olympian Zeus. Although the temple itself was destroyed, its preserved edges still give an idea of its original shape.
name: Temple of the Dioscuri

detail_description: Casa Natale di Luigi Pirandello e Tomba is a captivating destination for literature enthusiasts, located just 5 km southwest of Agrigento. This elegant villa, where the Nobel Prize-winning playwright and author was born, offers visitors a glimpse into his life through an array of memorabilia, photographs, and original manuscripts. The charming surroundings provide a serene atmosphere to explore the rooms filled with family history and literary treasures.
name: Casa Natale di Luigi Pirandello e Tomba

detail_description: Piazzale Ugo La Malfa is a vibrant hub in Agrigento, especially known for its lively market every Friday from 08:00 to 13:00. Here, visitors can explore an array of products at budget-friendly prices. The area also serves as a convenient parking spot for those looking to stroll up the hill into the charming town of Agrigento.
name: PARCHEGGIO PIAZZALE “UGO LA MALFA“

excerpt: Ancient, preserved Greek temple on a hill, with Doric architecture & interpretive information.
detail_description: The Temple of Concordia in Agrigento, Sicily is a well-preserved ancient Greek temple with Doric architecture. It is part of a larger site that includes eight temples and various other remains, all located in the same area. The temple itself is considered one of the world's best-preserved Doric temples and offers a romantic setting amidst wildflower-dotted landscapes with distant views of the sea. Visitors can explore the site on foot or take a minibus for convenience.
name: Temple of Concordia, Agrigento

detail_description: Via Ugo La Malfa is the location for Agrigento's bustling market, which takes place every Friday from 08:00 to 13:00. The market offers a diverse range of products at budget-friendly prices. Visitors can explore an extensive space filled with stalls selling fresh food, local culinary delights, home and garden accessories, as well as clothing.
name: V. Ugo La Malfa
Casuzza al Duomo con vista Valle dei Templi!

detail_description: Mudia_Museo Diocesan Agrigento is a captivating religious museum that takes visitors on a wonderful journey through various paintings depicting stories of the Almighty from the Cathedral of Agrigento. It houses artifacts dating back to the Norman age, adding significant historical value. The museum staff are professional and provide insights into the cathedral's thousand-year history and preserved relics. Due to ongoing consolidation works at the cathedral, many artworks have been transferred to this museum for preservation and ease of exploration by tourists.
name: Mudia_Museo Diocesan Agrigento

detail_description: The Museum of the Filippini, formerly known as the ex Collegio dei Filippini, is a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts. This 17th-century museum houses a remarkable collection of paintings spanning from the 14th to the 18th century. Visitors can admire artworks that showcase various artistic styles and periods. One particular artist not to be missed is Francesco Lojacono, renowned for his exquisite Sicilian landscape paintings in the 18th century.
name: Ex Collegio dei Filippini
